pageContext.claim: “I gave an interview yesterday to Bloomberg Business. And I said ‘off the record,’ and I made a statement about Canada. … And I said something strong, but it's my belief. And they violated it. And they said they were violating it. It's unbelievable what's happening with the fake news. It's unbelievable. When you say off the record, that's a very -- it's not a legal term, but it's a term of honor. … They actually printed my off-the-record. They said, ‘President Trump said, off the record’ and then they go on this.”
pageContext.analysis: Bloomberg News said it honored its agreement with Trump to keep his comments off the record and there's no evidence they disseminated these comments to others. Neither did Bloomberg publish a story with Trump's off-the-record comments. Daniel Dale, a reporter for the Toronto Star, obtained Trump's off-the-record statements about Canada from this Bloomberg interview and published them. Dale said he did not get Trump's off-the-record comments from Bloomberg.
